author: camilla
body:
https://i.imgsafe.org/7252ed86f2.jpg

### Drawing made with Prismacolor pencils on gray toned paper.
title: Girl with a Pink Bow

author: camilla
body:
### I made this drawing with my new Prismacolor pencils. I got them from the talented artist @Pixielols. I met her in real life today at the University and she is the sweetest and loveliest person you can imagine.

https://i.imgsafe.org/6dd4fe4912.jpg

 ### I had to test them right away so I just spent an hour on this autumn inspired apple drawing.  These color pencils are very soft and is a joy to work with.

https://i.imgsafe.org/6dc35d7e3c.jpg

### The apple have felt the warm sun on its red skin, drawn energy from the soil, nourished birds and children and heard the cold autumn wind in the leaves. It is a sweet gift from nature for you to enjoy.

https://i.imgsafe.org/6ddd3dee6b.jpg

### Thank you for visiting my post! I hope you liked it.
title: Apple Art

author: camilla
body:
### Where the Trees will not grow in the cold weather, where the houses are far apart but the hearts are close together.

https://i.imgsafe.org/52a5ddd3b8.jpg

### My Mother grew up here and I lived my first year in worlds most northern city called Hammerfest. The soil here is frozen, the land  is flat and full of stones but still the  tourists are very impressed.

https://i.imgsafe.org/52c7a83b71.jpg

### On a small island called Ertsvika my great grand parents lived with their 13 children. It was a hard life in poverty and cold winters, but their health where strong and their hearts where warm.

https://i.imgsafe.org/52c38d5ff5.jpg

### They lived of fishing and gathering berries. The next neighbors where 8 hours away by foot.  My great grand mother gave birth to all the children without any doctor to help her, the oldest daughter was the midwife. The oldest son had to fish with his father on the stormy ocean when he was 8 years old, he died early from hard work. 

https://i.imgsafe.org/52b994c30e.jpg

### Now the ancestors visit this place from time to time, where the old house used to be there is now a small cabin.  There is a peaceful land far far north where nobody lives only birds and raindeers. 

https://i.imgsafe.org/52ad9349ed.jpg

### The pictures are taken by my mother who is there now, visiting her mother and her childhood places. I hope you enjoyed this glimpse from the past.
root_title: There is a Land far, far North...
title: There is a Land far, far North...

author: camilla
body:
### I colored this  drawing with color pencils and markers. It took me about 6 hours to color in all the details.
https://i.imgsafe.org/496152e4bb.jpg

### The drawing is from Johanna Basfords coloring book: Enchanted Forest.
### I hope your autumn days are bright, peaceful and full of colors :)
title: Colors of the Falling Leaves

author: camilla
body:
https://i.imgsafe.org/462f04dde3.jpg

### I decided to color this drawing in evening colors, with moonlight and a mysterious atmosphere. I wonder who lives inside? 

### This is a coloring page from Johanna Basfords adult coloring book; The Enchanted Forest. It is a beautiful coloring book with a lot of detailed drawings for art lovers. I recommend you to try coloring, it is very fun and relaxing.
title: The Castle from my Dreams

author: camilla
body:
https://i.imgsafe.org/355673e5fe.jpg

### I colored this Peacock from Millie Marotta's Tropical Wonderland coloring book for adults. I love this drawing, but it took forever. Unfortunately I never finished it completely.
title: Colours of a Peacock

author: camilla
body:
### Adult coloring is a popular activity all over the world. People say it makes them more creative and peaceful. It is like a meditative practice! I have all the coloring books made by Johanna Basford. Her drawings are so detailed and beautiful and I love to color them. 
### Here is some of the pages I have colored so far:
### 1. The watering can
https://i.imgsafe.org/349cd53693.jpg

### 2. Colorful Plants
https://i.imgsafe.org/34a0a5aa73.jpg

### 3. The Bird (This is from Millie Marotta's tropical wonderland book)
https://i.imgsafe.org/34ea9ca68b.jpg

### 4. Heart of Flowers
https://i.imgsafe.org/34a0990260.jpg

### 5. The TreeHouse (not yet finished)
https://i.imgsafe.org/34eac272d9.jpg

### Which one do you like best?
### Do you like to color? 

### Maybe we should share our color pages here on Steem? :)
root_title: The Secret Garden: Do You Like to Colour?
title: The Secret Garden: Do You Like to Colour?

author: camilla
body:
https://i.imgsafe.org/3221da5276.jpg

### I made this drawing after an interesting LSD trip that changed me in many ways. I am not really sure what these spirits represent but they came from some kind of inhabited emptiness. I spent most of the trip in bed, in the darkness and silence and reorganized my brain. It felt like my universe opened itself up to become aware of even deeper parts of existence. 

### The next day I spent about 10 hours just drawing in silence without any plan, this is the result. I made it with markers and colored pencils. I hope you can find some wonder and courage in this drawing.
root_title: My LSD Spirits. Art on Acid
title: My LSD Spirits. Art on Acid

author: camilla
body:
<center>https://i.imgsafe.org/31a4097d43.jpg</center>

### Zendoodles are fun and relaxing to make and does not take much time or skill. I like drawing them while listening to lectures to help my brain process information easier. I made this one with markers and gel pens. I hope you like it :)
title: Zendoodle Drawing

author: camilla
body:
#### There was a lot of students, more than 200 and mostly girls. They are all western, privileged straight A students just out of highschool. Most of them chose psychology because it is the most intriguing subject that is still sensible and useful to society. 

https://i.imgsafe.org/c75a36832c.jpg

#### How many of us will make it? Only time can tell. The first ones to fall will be those who just realized that psychology is not at all what they thought it was. Soon those who can't read english will disappear. (The books and tests are in english) Then the undisciplined and lazy ones will be gone and last to fall will be the scared and the doubtful. I can already see it in their eyes, I'm one of them. Somehow I always pull through. What I lack in confidence I make up for in the ability to push myself. 
https://i.imgsafe.org/c75a75be50.jpg

#### We have to pass 6 out of nine multiple choice test to be allowed to take the exam. On the exam we have to answer 6 out of seven questions in 6 hours. Two of them will be about the history of psychology. 

#### The curriculum consist of one giant brick of a book with 900 pages. We have to read it all and remember everything. Then there is one history book, it is not so big and not as important. There is also a number of articles. I assume that I will have to spend at least 3 hours a day with my psychology studies to get a good grade. I can do this!

https://i.imgsafe.org/c71a9983e3.jpg
### The main book Thankfully it has a lot of good illustrations and pictures in it and it is very organised and well written. 
https://i.imgsafe.org/c71cf8d3d8.jpg

### The history book is in Norwegian, which makes it a bit easier. 
https://i.imgsafe.org/c72195f224.jpg

#### Before the lecture I took some time to make a healthy breakfast, Avocadoes and Tomatoes with olive oil, salt, pepper balsamic and some bread. It served me well today. 
https://i.imgsafe.org/c717cebc5f.jpg

#### The road from the subway to the psychological institute is a beautiful walk through a field with a great view of the sunny sky. It made me feel optimistic and calm.
https://i.imgsafe.org/c75a1aed08.jpg

### The institute is located by a psychiatrical hospital, on the outskirts of campus. 
https://i.imgsafe.org/c75a2edf50.jpg

### We have well known and highly competent psychology professors in the lectures. The one we we had today was this guy: 
http://www.sv.uio.no/psi/personer/vit/rolfreb/rolfreb.jpg 
#### Rolf Reber from Germany. He is a professor in cognitive psychology and have also written some articles about emotions and aesthetics according to the university website. He was funny and interesting to listen to. He talked about the usefulness of psychology and the scientific methods. He also gave us a lot of practical information and talked about interesting psychological phenomenons like how astrology can trick us into reading our horoscope and many other exiting things.

### My “notes” 

https://i.imgsafe.org/c727fedbe4.jpg
https://i.imgsafe.org/c725451d1c.jpg

#### I also talked to a few of the students I sat next too. One girl had finally gotten into the profession studies to become an actual working psychologist after 3 years of hard work to get high enough grades. You need to have A in all exams to get into psychology profession studies. Thankfully the pressure is not as high for a useless philosophy student.

### I hope you enjoyed taking a look inside the life of a university student. I will keep posting about my life at Uni. so follow me if you find it interesting.
title: My first Psychology Lecture
